title: Distributive Property
text: Observing this question, we find that we will need to apply the distributive property twice, once for each of the parentheses.

title: Distributive Property
text: The distributive property states that if a, $$b$$, c are real numbers, then $$a \left(b+c\right)=ab+ac$$, and $$a \left(b-c\right)=ab-ac$$.
speech: The distributive property states that if a,  b , c are real numbers, then , a, parentheses b plus c,  is equal to a b plus a c , and , a, parentheses b minus c,  is equal to, a b minus a c .
pacedSpeech: The distributive property states that if a,   b
, c are real numbers, then  , a,  b plus c,  is equal to a b plus a c
, and  , a,  b minus c,  is equal to, a b minus a c

title: Applying the Distributive Property
text: Applying the distributive property to $$6\left(7y+8\right)$$, we get the expression $$6\times7 y+6\times8$$.
speech: Applying the distributive property to  6 times, parentheses, 7 y plus 8,  , we get the expression  6 times 7 y plus 6 times 8 .
pacedSpeech: Applying the distributive property to   6 times, , 7 y plus 8,
, we get the expression   6 times 7 y plus 6 times 8

title: First Expression
text: Putting together the previous two parts, we get $$6\left(7y+8\right)=42y+48$$.
speech: Putting together the previous two parts, we get  6 times, parentheses, 7 y plus 8,  is equal to, 42 y plus 48 .
pacedSpeech: Putting together the previous two parts, we get   6 times, , 7 y plus 8,  is equal to, 42 y plus 48

title: Applying the Distributive Property
text: Applying the distributive property to $$-(30y-15)$$, we get the expression $$-1\times30 y-15\left(-1\right)$$ (remember that $$-(30y-15)$$ can be written as (-1)*(30y-15)).
speech: Applying the distributive property to  minus parentheses, 30 y minus 15,  , we get the expression , negative 1 times 30 y minus, 15 times negative 1,  (remember that  minus, parentheses, 30 y minus 15,   can be written as (-1)*(30y-15)).
pacedSpeech: Applying the distributive property to   minus , 30 y minus 15,
, we get the expression  , negative 1 times 30 y minus, 15 times negative 1,

title: Multiplying
speech: What is , 30 times negative 1 times y ?
pacedSpeech: What is  , 30 times negative 1 times y

title: Second Expression
text: Putting together the previous two parts, we get $$-(30y-15)=-30y-(-15)=-30y+15$$.
speech: Putting together the previous two parts, we get  minus, parentheses, 30 y minus 15,  is equal to, negative 30 y, minus negative 15 is equal to, negative 30 y, plus 15 .
pacedSpeech: Putting together the previous two parts, we get   minus, , 30 y minus 15,  is equal to, negative 30 y, minus negative 15 is equal to, negative 30 y, plus 15

title: Combine Like Terms
text: After applying the distributive property, the expression becomes $$42y+48-30y+15$$. Combine like terms, what do you get?
speech: After applying the distributive property, the expression becomes  42 y plus 48 minus 30 y plus 15 . Combine like terms, what do you get?
pacedSpeech: After applying the distributive property, the expression becomes   42 y plus 48 minus 30 y plus 15
. Combine like terms, what do you get?
